attributes.action: Provide financial help for victims of domestic violence
attributes.background:
Give them the freedom to escape their situation without having to worry about the financial repercussions. Even if they own their own homes there should be support since often they would have been financially dependent on their abuser.
Freedom to escape without facing potential homelessness
attributes.additional_details: There is no financial help for people with a mortgage, even if they cant afford to pay the mortgage, have no job and no income. Temporary help would give people that safety net they need to have the courage to leave an abusive relationship without having to worry about becoming homeless. The housing register rejects applicants based on a tick box saying yes i have a mortgaged property - it takes months to sell a house and everyone deserves to have a safe home to live in.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: Raise the Help to Buy ISA qualifying limit to £300k to match Stamp Duty policy.
attributes.background: It was recently announced that Stamp Duty was abolished for first time buyers on properties up to £300,000. However, Help to Buy ISA’s only qualify for the bonus on properties up to £250,000. I feel this qualifying limit should be raised to £300,000 to be in line with the new Stamp Duty.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists use cycle paths where provided rather than using roads.
attributes.background:
Why as a cyclist would we want to not use an area dedicated to us for our safety, and irritate motor vehicle drivers by not using what has cost thousands of pounds to provide.
If we use these dedicated cycle ways we will reduce the amount of accidents and injuries to fellow cyclists.

attributes.action: Stop involvement in the Afghan, Syrian and Iraqi Wars and bring troops home
attributes.background: Our involvement as the UK to stop the ongoing wars is the problem.  People are unhappy that we are continuously involved in the different wars and spending too much money on the wars when we could spend it on something useful in the UK. This is a major problem and could assist other campaigns
attributes.additional_details: We are spending a net amount of at least £20.3 billion just until 2010 (combined of only the cost of the afghan and Iraqi war).Many sources state that we are spending at least 37 billion by 2017 a statement by guardian stated “By 2020, Britain will have spent at least £40bn on its Afghan campaign, enough to recruit over 5,000 police officers or nurses and pay for them throughout their careers. It could fund free tuition for all students in British higher education for 10 years."

attributes.action: Make the Monday after Remembrance Sunday a bank holiday.
attributes.background: A lot of people like to travel to the Remembrance Sunday parades. Many of these people are ex-service personnel now working for civilian companies, having the Monday off would allow them to travel to London for example or where they spent much of their service life such as Portsmouth & Plymouth
attributes.additional_details: for the Navy and Aldershot for the Army. They would be able to travel with their families and meet with old comrades and the people who are serving now so they can share memories and stories of old friends who are no longer with us and the places they have been and things they have seen.

attributes.action: Make tax incentives and laws for companies allowing people to work  from home.
attributes.background: Because a lot of people travel into work in cities we are overloading the traffic infrastructure, creating pollution. parking problems and destroying country villages. Give companies incentives to allow them to support home workers, remove laws making companies for being responsible for home areas.
attributes.additional_details: companies are made responsible for the environment that people are working in at home, allow workers to opt out of this protection so they can work at home. Companies should only be responsible for the computers and equipment they supply nothing else. this will allow people with children to work from home. also companies can use more part time workers.

attributes.action: Hold a Public Inquiry into >45000 extra deaths linked to austerity since 2010
attributes.background: A recent study published in the BMJ showed a correlation between cuts to social and healthcare funding and higher than expected national mortality rates since 2010. A Public Inquiry should be held in order to determine whether Government Austerity measures have led to an increase in death rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Long term under funding of health and social care services has led to widespread suffering, a decline physical and mental health and vulnerable people being put at risk. Lack of funding may also be responsible for >45000 deaths since 2010. If this is the case, harmful government action and policy must be reversed and responsible politicians held to account over these deaths.

Study: http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/7/11/e017722

attributes.action: Pass legislation for the use of indelible ink pens mandatory for ALL elections.
attributes.background: In an age where pens are as cost effective as pencils, there is no excuse why the use of indelible ink pens should not be made mandatory. Old arguments on cost and potential for ink to smudge are not relevant today. However, a perception votes cast using a pencil can be manipulated, is a concern.

attributes.action: Make national rugby accessible to all to watch
attributes.background:
Home nation rugby should be available to all through live coverage on terrestrial tv channels.
It is absurd that one of our home nation teams playing one of our most popular sports is now only available to those who can afford to, and pre-plan to use subscription television.
attributes.additional_details: How can we be expected to support & celebrate our own nation in a sport in which we are world class when we are unable to watch without subscribing? The move of national sport from terrestrial TV to subscription services is going to gradually quench the ability for supporters to follow their nation & ultimately reduce participation in the sport. Not only will this reduce the passion for our nation but reduce any future prospects for a world leading team when we are at the very peak of the game.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from the road and allow them on the pavement
attributes.background: Cyclists should be banned from the road, as they can be dangerous to drivers on the road and they are slow and they block your path. They sometimes don’t follow the rules of the road when there is traffic and they go onto pavement. Hence why they should be legally allowed to stick to the pavement.

attributes.action: Cut the overseas budget
attributes.background: The Prime Minster Should and must cut the overseas budget by 75% and spend the money on rectifying our countries finacial parlous position, and stop the ever continuing cuts.

attributes.action: Provide a 9-1 GCSE Law syllabus and encourage examination boards to follow it.
attributes.background: GCSE law is a great qualification as it allows students who do not have the knowledge to perform at a-level to show their ability in another way. Sadly, all the exam boards that provide the subject will scrap it in 2018. This petition calls on the government to provide a syllabus after that.
attributes.additional_details:
"GCSE Law helps students to develop skills of selection, analysis, critical thinking and decision making, and builds an awareness of the rights and responsibilities of individuals" AQA
Without this subject, we risk causing a lack of knowledge around students who no longer have any reason to study law at 16. All the exam boards... Namely OCR and AQA plan to abolish the subject! http://www.aqa.org.uk/subjects/law/gcse/law-4160
http://www.ocr.org.uk/qualifications/gcse-law-j485-from-2012/

attributes.action: Require labelling of all products which contain pig or its bye products
attributes.background: Lot of products edible or for human use are in the market which contain pig and its bye products without specifying. Jellies, soaps, breads and spreads etc. can contain lard or pig bones without specifying. This hurts lots of people’s sentiments and beliefs.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to kill llamas in slaughterhouses.
attributes.background: It is actually legal to kill and eat llama if it is killed in an approved slaughterhouse. We personally love llamas and would like to make it illegal for llamas to be killed.

attributes.action: All government agencies to stop using marital status titles for women
attributes.background:
Current marital status title's for women: Miss – unmarried Mrs – married Ms – divorced. 

Propose to replace with Ms only to indicate a female. This is aligned with Mr to indicate a male.
attributes.additional_details:
A women's place in society is no longer dictated by her marital status. 

Requesting marital status on all applications/forms has no relevance and the government agencies should update this archaic practise and be brought in line and equal with men, where only a gender acknowledgement is required.

attributes.action: The Government should buy Leonardo da Vinci's "Salvatore Mundi" for the nation
attributes.background: Painted by Leonardo at his best, fully authenticated, a snip at £75 million.
attributes.additional_details: If the French have " Mona Lisa", why can't we have "Salvatore Mundi"?

attributes.action: Introduce a cap on the cost of postgraduate degrees
attributes.background: Postgraduate fees are not governed by the same rules that undergraduate fees are. Student are regularly left with a short fall and having to money to help pay for courses or living costs. There is no consistency with postgraduate fees like there is with undergraduate fees.
attributes.additional_details: Postgraduate courses can vary from £6000 up to £25000, meaning that students may have to find and extra £15000 to pay for the course after and if they receive the full £10000 loan from the government, that doesn’t include living costs! This is clearly putting a number of students at a disadvantage and preventing them from studying postgraduate courses as many will not able to find this amount of money. We should be encouraging education, therefore a cap on fees would be the best option.

attributes.action: Formally support UN condemnation of the Saudi bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera.
attributes.background: A UN High Commissioner has condemned the Saudi-led bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera as an "unacceptable attack on the right to freedom of expression and opinion". The government should explicitly support the UN and oppose the Salman regime's attempt to censor TV channels available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UN High Commissioner is Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein:
http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/06/high-commissioner-zeid-raad-al-hussein-call-shut-al-jazeera-unacceptable-attack-170630111642647.html

It is unacceptable to tolerate Saudi interference in what British audiences should be permitted to watch. The government should issue a formal declaration of support for the UN and unequivocally repudiate such Saudi meddling in our sources of news. It is not for the Saudis to censor our television channels.

attributes.action: Schools to have paediatric adrenaline auto-injectors for children in anaphylaxis
attributes.background: Schools have an increasing number of children with severe allergies. There have been at least 2 cases recently of a child dying from anaphylaxis at school. Each school having their own adrenaline auto injectors could contribute to saving a child’s life when they are having an anaphylactic event.
attributes.additional_details: Each school would need 2 paediatric auto injectors which would be kept in an area accessible and known to all staff. Staff would also check the product is in date.

attributes.action: Fund Sound Therapy For People With Tourette Syndrome
attributes.background: My name is Jason, im a 20 year old male who suffers from Tourette Syndrome, i have suffered this for many years now and can NOT get the funding to join a sound therapy course
attributes.additional_details: i believe sound therapy would be extremely influential into helping solve the ongoing problem "how do i handle my tics" or "how do i cure my tourettes?" the simple answer is, there is NO cure for Tourette Syndrome, however after research, and being a musician myself, music and drama both seem to reduce the amount i tic, i also underwent a short taster of sound therapy and it reduced my tics sufficiently, i want to help people without tourette understand and people with, to manage it.

attributes.action: Raise basic salaries for 999 emergency call handlers
attributes.background: After watching a TV documentary series, the extremely difficult, high pressure and increasingly busy environment that 999 emergency call handlers experience, it seems unfair that their basic salaries are relatively low.
attributes.additional_details:
£15,000-£26,000 is apparently the salary expected for this role

https://nationalcareersservice.direct.gov.uk/job-profiles/emergency-medical-dispatcher

Although the entire NHS is financially stretched, and all NHS staff should ideally be paid more than they are currently, it is clear to see from watching this documentary, that the extreme pressures that these call handlers work under should be rewarded with a higher basic salary for the amazing work they do!

attributes.action: Make it law for every alcohol transaction to require approved photo ID
attributes.background: Many shop assistants every day are physically or verbally abused for asking for proof of age when purchasing alcohol a simple change to the law requiring that approved ID must be shown for every transaction would help reduce attempted under age purchases and remove cashier errors in assessing age
attributes.additional_details:
A simple law that states no ID no sale on alcohol would remove the possibility of human error in judging people's ages and would help to Reduce verbal and physical confrontations if customers knew the law was no ID no sale.
Across the country workers have been subjected to abuse because of guessing a customers age who subsequently causes a scene in an attempt to intimidate the cashier into selling the product.
A No ID no sale law would be a simple fix so everyone knows where they stand.

attributes.action: Brexit deal must contain a clause allowing us rejoin the EU on the same terms
attributes.background:
As a form of insurance against a potentially destructive Brexit we the undersigned petition the government to include a clause in any deal with the EU to allow us to rejoin on the exact same terms we are on now.

This will give us the ultimate get out clause if Brexit is as damaging as predicted.

attributes.action: Remove Widows Parents Allowance as an income on Universal Credit Claims
attributes.background: Universal Credit claims currently see Widows Parents Allowance as an income. Therefore any claim made by a widow is penalised resulting in the total amount of Widows Parents Allowance being deducted from their claim resulting in a far lesser payment of Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Widows Parents Allowance is exactly that, an allowance to help a widowed parent support and provide for their young children following the loss of the child's/children's parent.
I alone will not be able to make changes to the Universal Credit criteria, but feel strongly that the inclusion of Widows Parents Allowance in any Universal Credit claim should be reconsidered. Support should be given by our Government to those trying to better themselves following the devastating loss of a husband/wife

attributes.action: Put retirement age back to 60 for females and 60 for men.
attributes.background: I am 58 years old. Working with all sorts of conditions: COPD; Glucoma; 2 bad discs; Arthritis. To try and get time off to see a doctor is almost impossible. Getting up is a struggle. But I am not entitled to disability as I can dress wash and feed myself. Everyday is a struggle.

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Make "Jerusalem" England's official national anthem by law
attributes.background: Two years ago, a bill passed the first reading backing the call to consider an official national anthem for the nation of England to be played for major UK and Commonwealth events. This petition builds on that bill, and humbly asks to make 'Jerusalem' the official national anthem of England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-35296296, "MPs back calls for English national anthem". BBC News. London: BBC. 13 January 2016.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2015-16/englishnationalanthem.html, English National Anthem Bill 2015-16.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rT1HEXNI9c4, 'Jerusalem', the song in question.

attributes.action: Erase CCJ immediately from records once debts are fully paid.
attributes.background: A CCJ on record for 6 years can be the end of normal life for most. 6 months career break alone is dangerous, 6 years is destructive. That Mortgages will be lost, homes break under financial burden, people look to emigrate over a £300 registered debt is ludicrous & the judgements too easily applied.

attributes.action: Create a permanent independent committee to check that the BBC is not biased.
attributes.background: After brexit many people are becoming increasingly concerned that the BBC is trying to promote its own views. We all pay for the BBC and it should be completely even handed in its presentations.

attributes.action: Examine the benefits of Driver CPC EU Dir 2003/59 with a view to scrapping it.
attributes.background: The driver CPC was initiated as a European Directive to provide periodic training to all vocational licence holders. The scheme is of no benefit and is merely a cash generator for the agencies administering it.

attributes.action: national insurance to be used solely to fund the NHS
attributes.background: National insurance payments to be used solely to fund the NHS and social care budget for the elderly . as suggested by various forward thinking politicians and not be used as another stealth tax

attributes.action: A final referendum on EU membership at the same time as a General Election.
attributes.background:
Once this Government has completed their negotiations with the EU27, they should resign and a General Election be called before implementing our departure from the EU.

At the same time a binding referendum on EU membership be held and the subsequent Parliament be obliged to implement the result.
attributes.additional_details: This would ensure a proper debate on the issues, with the electorate clear about the consequences of their votes.  There would be no reason to object to the result with all the facts known and new Parliament elected fully aware of its obligations.

attributes.action: Make St George's Day in England and St Andrew's day in Wales public holidays
attributes.background: Scotland and Northern Ireland both get public holidays for their patron saint, why should England and Wales not get the same privilege?

attributes.action: Build Nuclear Bunkers sufficient for the population accounting for growth.
attributes.background: There is and always has been since creation a threat of nuclear attack, currently as individuals there is effectively nothing we can to protect ourselves from an attack for example from North Korea, in the event of nuclear attack millions of people would be helplessly destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: I would ask that the government ensure the construction regardless of the financial cost of nuclear shelters in major urban population centres for all persons of the area and accounting for influx of peoples to the shelters from outside of the area and population growth so that people can protect themselves from a nuclear attack, I would ask people be quickly and indiscriminately accepted into these shelters and essentials be available for prolonged life from within the shelter.

attributes.action: Abolish Political Parties and create a collective body of independent MPs.
attributes.background: Great ideas can come from anyone. The possibility that a great idea will fall by the wayside due to some in-built bias of the current Party political/adversarial setup is wrong. Our current Parliamentary system encourages and rewards political bullying (from the whips) and loyalty to the Party line.
attributes.additional_details: Independent MPs would strengthen the relationship (and possibly form new types of relationships) between MPs and their constituents. An MP who today finds it necessary to follow the Party line, which in many cases is against their constituents beliefs, will find it easier to be more in tune with the people they represent and 100% accountable to the same. We have had enough of adversarial wrangling and it is time to try something new - a collective Parliament as is evident anywhere else in nature

attributes.action: Ban all stand alone ATM’s
attributes.background: Everyday the news and social media are reporting on the increasing crime of Ram Raids on shops for the stand alone cash machines (ATM). Some of these shops have been targeted more than once. This has to stop, and the only way we can help, is to have the stand alone machines removed from shops now.
attributes.additional_details: The Police can only advise shopkeepers on security and not enforce it, and the stand alone ATM’s do not have trackers fitted or ‘Smart’ Water. I am asking for these cash machines to be removed from shops, and the initial temptation for these criminals will also be removed. Livelihoods, jobs, are all disrupted. Bank / Post office branch cash machines are better installed and are rarely raided, we live in a world where we pay for things via apps, so cash is not that essential.

attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in Children's Homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013) on average £133,000 - £148,000 per child per year, yet it will cost a parent approximately £25,000 - £30,000 per year to send their child to a top boarding school to receive the best education money can buy, and those that attend boarding school don’t end up in prison. This is one of many viable solutions to consider

attributes.action: Make the drink driving limit for alcohol zero
attributes.background: This action would remove ambiguity for everyone and would lead to increased safety on the Uk roads

attributes.action: Fund higher-level classes for profoundly gifted GCSE students
attributes.background: Many highly intelligent pupils feel abandoned by their secondary schools in the UK. Their ability to work and absorb new information at faster rate results in the majority of their time in school being unproductive, wasting time that should be spent realising their potential in academia.

attributes.action: The UK stays in the customs union as part of the Brexit process.
attributes.background: The UK is a trading nation and free movement of our goods within the EU is critical. Being a member does not prevent the UK from trading with other countries - we do so now. It simply means that tariffs have to be paid in certain circumstances. It would also solve the Ireland impasse at stroke.
attributes.additional_details: Most MPs support the customs union being retained but Brexiteers want it removed in order to enable this country to negotiate trade deals with other countries. Not having a trade deal does not prevent members of the union from trading with other countries. Germany for example trades a great deal with China as we do with the USA. Tariffs have to be paid in some circumstances but that does not stop trading.

attributes.action: Armed Forces Veterans should be entitled to concessionary rail travel.
attributes.background: Should have the same entitlement to discounted rail travel as serving members.
attributes.additional_details: As a Royal Navy veteran (23 years under the waves) I feel it unfair that there is no mechanism in place to obtain a railcard other than the normal route, ie Family & Friends, Disability, 16-25 or wait until I reach 60. Serving our country is an honour and requires a massive commitment for many years, so I do not feel it is too much to ask for a small token to help with travel costs, especially when none of the other cards are valid for the lone, uninjured, pre-State Pension Veteran traveller.

attributes.action: Create a ‘Residential Care Voucher’ scheme
attributes.background: As a parent to a young child, I can take advantage of the tax-efficient way to pay towards her childcare. I propose a similar scheme be set up so that people can save towards the often unmanageable costs surrounding residential care for elderly loved ones.
attributes.additional_details:
A scheme should exist where:
Employees can pay into a ‘pot’ that is dedicated to the residential / end-of-life care of loved ones.
Monies saved are protected by a government-backed scheme (similar to savings at the bank)
Savings to the employee are present through salary-sacrifice
Monies deposited  are available should they become not necessary
People can chose to pay into their own account and/or an account for a relative/friend 

The scheme should mirror the current childcare voucher scheme

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Wild Animals Act to Exotic and Dangerous Wild Animals Act
attributes.background: Amend the DWA, making it a legal obligation to possess a license for ownership of any wild or non-native species; preventing whimsical buying of animals with specialist care needs to safeguard animal welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Buying without researching care needs of specific animals is especially damaging to reptiles which suffer from ailments, like metabolic bone disease, as a result of improper husbandry. Introducing a license for exotic pet ownership should encourage people buying to understand the commitment they are undertaking, particularly if paired with expert consultation at the time of license purchase. The "EDWA" should also aim to hold accountable those involved in crimes against the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Establish an independent board that investigates complaints against the Police
attributes.background: After our own personal experiences of accessing the Police Complaints System we soon realised it is not fit for purpose.  We  represent a large number of victims  and all of those who have made a complaint to the Police have either not had their complaint investigated or had a satisfactory outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Presently the Police investigate themselves and this is obvious it is open to misconduct.  We and our victims we represent have complained to the IPCC on numerous occasions and they will not investigate the Police often sending the complaint straight back to the Professional Standards Department.  We want a Police Complaints system totally independent to the Police made up of members trained in Law and with civilian oversight and a number of victims of crime on the panel.

attributes.action: Increase the Penalty for NOT STOPPING after an Accident on the Highway by Driver
attributes.background: There are far too many Drivers these days who HIT and RUN, at this time the Penalty is far too Low and needs a Large increase, many are Killed and it is Gutless Not to stop, I know some of these may have a reason like No Insurance or wanted by the Police, they are Cowards when the persons are dying
attributes.additional_details:
In the Media there are cases every week now, this needs Controlling with adverts detailing the Penalty increase, it is a shame where things are going these days making life Cheap.

Let’s try and get things Changed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for coaches to transport children with inadequate seatbelts
attributes.background: In 2016 4% of road deaths were children (a). The law states very clearly that "you can be fined up to £500 if a child isn’t in the correct seat while you’re driving" (b).  Yet currently minibuses and coaches are exempt; "the law does not require passengers under 14 years old to wear a seat belt" (c)
attributes.additional_details:
(a) https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/648081/rrcgb2016-01.pdf

(b) https://www.gov.uk/seat-belts-law 

(c) http://www.childcarseats.org.uk/the-law/other-vehicles-buses-coaches-and-minibuses/

attributes.action: Reform the General Election voting system -- ditch FPTP, introduce MMP (AMS).
attributes.background: FPTP is the current voting system the UK uses in its General Elections. FPTP is very 2-party orientation and is ideal in a country with no minor parties. With MMP, parliament can be much more representative of what UK citizens actually want and not restricted to tactical voting.
attributes.additional_details:
In the second most recent, the 2015 General Election, Conservatives received 36.9% of the popular vote, however, received 51% of the seats in parliament (which translates to 100% of the power as they received a majority).
Although receiving a majority in parliament, the Conservatives did not receive a majority of UK citizens wanting them in power.
An even more extreme example, UKIP, who received 12.6% of the popular vote, only received one seat (0.15% of the total seats) in parliament. (Source: http://www.ukpolitical.info/2015.htm)

attributes.action: Health Insurance schemes MUST include cover for counselling & Hypnotherapy
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people are affected by mental health disorders & urgently need access to affordable therapies. The NHS simply cannot cope & our mental health services are in crisis. Astonishingly, the Health Insurance Industry does not consider 'health' to include mental well being & fails to provide cover.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does the Health Insurance Industry provide cover for your body but not for your mind? 

Why can you get cover or claim money back when you see an Acupuncturist/Osteopath/Chiropractor but you can't get the same cover to see a Therapist?

Hypnotherapy is quick & effective treatment for a range of mental health issues, including; anxiety, depression, fears, phobias & addictions - ultimately helping reduce the burden on the NHS. So why is Hypnotherapy not covered under health insurance schemes?

attributes.action: Abolish the 60% stealth income tax
attributes.background: The effective income tax rate for earnings of £100,000 - £123,000 is 60%, as the tax free allowance drops away. So the tax rate goes from 40% for earnings under £100,000, up to 60%, and then back down to 40% for earnings between £123,000 and £150,000. Truly bizzare.
attributes.additional_details: This tax rate is a clear disincentive for those earning around £100,000 (mainly those seen as "wealth creators"). So much so that the vast majority will surely act to avoid this rate (e.g. By paying into their pensions). This is dragging liquidity away from the market and therefore adversely affecting everyone in the country.
